website_summaries.verdict: Authentic, weighty chess pieces are exciting to play with, but the chessboard is small and cheaply made.
pros: Heavy, large plastic chess pieces (from 2 inches to 4 inches high) in contrasting dark and light gray, stored in  velvet bags
cons: The cardboard chessboard is disappointing compared to the exciting pieces, and too small

customer_reviews.title: Cheap plastic and cardboard
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, if this had been $20-$25, I'd be pretty thrilled. However, at $50 I expected more. The pieces are plastic. They're awesomely designed and look very cool, but they're just molded plastic. They are very light and fall over a lot, which is super annoying. I'll probably weigh them down with something but I'm not sure yet what. Also, the board is cheap cardboard. It feels very, very very cheap. If the plastic game pieces were weighted and the board was even low-grade wood, I'd be happy at the $50 price point, but as it is it isn't good.
customer_reviews.author: CDM

customer_reviews.title: A nerds perfect storm of chess and HP
customer_reviews.text: A nerds perfect storm of chess and HP. You get exactly what's pictured. Pieces are a plastic resin made to look like stone. Some are a little top heavy. Storage bags work well but a carrying case with slots would have been better.
customer_reviews.author: Laura, the Mainah

customer_reviews.title: Cheap plastic, flimsy cardboard, mismatched game pieces
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived with two white Kings, no queen. The instruction sheet was missing also. Very disappointed, not worthy of the Harry Potter namesake.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Stevens

customer_reviews.title: FUN FOR HARRY POTTER FANS!
customer_reviews.text: What a great Harry Potter chess set for the price! The pieces are very detailed and the game board is attractive. Although the board folds into quarters, it stays quite flat when opened and the fold seams are not noticeable. The thick board (cardboard) seems durable if used with reasonable care. The chess men have a good heft to them. Although some pieces are a bit top-heavy, if moved carefully around the board, they should not topple over. The bags holding the chess pieces are attractive, but if the pieces are not arranged just right in their bags, the lid of the box won't close completely. Still, excellent value for the modest price.
customer_reviews.author: BETTY T.

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected....
customer_reviews.text: Wish I had known it would be plastic and cardboard.... seems pretty cheap for a $45 gift.
customer_reviews.author: GMS

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely not worth the $100 price tag
customer_reviews.text: For $100 you will get cheap, molded plastic in which many of the thinner pieces will be bent because they are all thrown into two plastic bags. The board is quad-fold cardboard, and unaesthetically displays "Harry Potter" and "Wizard Chess Set" multiple times around the board. If the pieces feel light and cheap, its because bottom of each one is hollow, making the top-heavy pieces able to fall over easily. Also, the knight piece takes up too much room in the space in front of it and causes the pawn to be out of place, very unlike the picture shown. This set is not worth more than $20, you are paying the extra $80 for the name "Harry Potter."
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Son loves it!
customer_reviews.text: We got this for our son's 10th birthday and he loves it. The pieces are plastic and are not heavy at all, but they are very detailed. The board is very nice looking.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Walch

customer_reviews.title: Good quality for the money
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty good chess set. Honestly I wish the pieces were made out of better material but I understand about the possibility of the pieces breaking while playing. I just bought mine for display purposes so I may search the Internet more for a higher quality one. But, this one is pretty good. Also, the board is a cardboard type one that folds like most board games. Overall I'm satisfied with the quality for the money. I just may spend more money one day for a better quality one.
customer_reviews.author: Erika Lyne Hampton

customer_reviews.title: Very expensive, but made very cheaply and is not worth it
customer_reviews.text: This product was not exactly cheap, and I was very disappointed in the poor quality of this product. For the price it was, I was hoping the individual pieces would at least be solid plastic and somewhat sturdy, but the chess pieces are hollow and flimsy. The board was simple and one of the bags came torn. The bags themselves were extremely thin and poorly constructed. Overall, the set was made embarrassingly cheap, yet it is very expensively priced. Would definitely not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: That Guy

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful Set
customer_reviews.text: I bought this chess set for my son, for Christmas. Not only was he thrilled to receive a replica of the set from Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone, but he (a 13-yr-old) spent time admiring the set. The pieces are a plastic with speckles, to make it look like stone, and the board is glossy. He was impressed that the pieces came in organza bags printed with gold foil "Harry Potter...". I am actually thinking of buying a second set, for my younger son, and I wasn't exciting about spending more than $30 the first time, but it was well worth the $45 I paid.
customer_reviews.author: RosesAQT

customer_reviews.title: Made my daughter very happy
customer_reviews.text: My daughter squealed incomprehensible words while shaking like she'd grabbed hold of a live 120V line when she opened it. I played a few games with her, and it seems to be a decent quality set, in line with price considering royalties paid to the franchise. Some things to be aware of, while the pieces are *solid*, they are plastic, and some of them are top-heavy (the knights, most notable), and the board seems a touch small for the pieces (again, the knights). If she continues to play and doesn't lose interest or the pieces, I'll probably get a slightly larger board for her.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Plocki

customer_reviews.title: Great chess set!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this set for my eight year old son. He loves playing chess, and recently discovered all things Harry Potter. He loves this set so much! It’s well made and will provide hours of screen free entertainment.
customer_reviews.author: Jodi Pietraru

customer_reviews.title: Don't get your hopes up
customer_reviews.text: I thought it would at least be glass or metal pieces and a solid board. What I got was plastic pieces and cardboard fold out playing board. Really disappointed about that.
customer_reviews.author: Amber bourg

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected
customer_reviews.text: This was 40.00. Not worth it. It's a cheap quarter fold, thin, cardboard chess board. The picture makes it look like a nice, thick board. Granted I should have read the specs and didnt on this one. Also The pieces are very lightweight and hollow plastic. I know everything "Harry Potter" is expensive. I was disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Vicki Baldwin-Flynn

customer_reviews.title: Good chess set
customer_reviews.text: Love this Harry Potter chess set. It is so fun to play with. Quality is also good
customer_reviews.author: Gunjan

customer_reviews.title: HORRIBLE. CHEAP MATERIALS. NOT WORTH YOUR MONEY
customer_reviews.text: I'm a huge Potterhead but, this chess set is complete garbage. The pieces are made of really cheap plastic and the board is just flimsy cardboard. Most of the pieces are extremely top-heavy because the manufacturers were too stingy to make the bottom solid plastic so if you even slightly bump the board everything falls over. Image how frustrating it is to be in the middle of an intense game and literally everything goes flying, EVERY TIME. If this was $20 maybe it'd be passable, but having paid $50 for it, I'm just SO disappointed. If I could give this zero stars I would.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Chen

customer_reviews.title: Fun game but need better quality control
customer_reviews.text: We bought this and it was missing a white knight. We ordered a 2nd set and several of the pieces were either not set on the base properly or the plastic was discolored. We were able to get one really nice set out of it. I also think a sturdier board would've been nice for the amount it cost. Love the way the game pieces look and is fun to play with the giant sized pieces. Although we had trouble getting a nice set, we do now enjoy the one we have.
customer_reviews.author: Jerrilynn M Noggle

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for any Harry Potter fan
customer_reviews.text: I saw this set in a gift shop at Universal Studios and was so drawn to it! Problem was, I didn’t know how to play chess! So I told myself, if I can learn how to play I will treat myself and buy this. I have yet to win a game (keep getting stalemate), but having so much fun with this. Nice big peices that are replicas of the ones in the chess scene. You’re paying for the Harry Potter name, not necessarily the quality.
customer_reviews.author: Haley

customer_reviews.title: I don’t want to play with any other chess set ever again.
customer_reviews.text: My son has been asking for a chess set, and he recently became obsessed with Harry Potter. (Yes, I’m an amazing parent, as you can see.) so buying him this chess set was a no brainer! The pieces are impressively large and feel pretty sturdy. My four year old takes the captured pieces and plays ponies with them, and they’ve survived that quite well! My son loves playing chess with this set and chooses it rather than the “instructor set” his aunt for for him. My only complaint is that the board folds into fourths and I’m worried it will split down the seams fairly quickly. The board itself is very thick though!
customer_reviews.author: Teacher Gal

customer_reviews.title: Classic
customer_reviews.text: As a chess set this falls slightly short as the board is a quad fold and will not hold up to alot of packing and un packing. The pieces are top heavy making it a bit delicate to play. The magic is in the detail of the pieces. I got this as a birthday present for my daughter, who I am teaching chess, and she instantly knew what it was and was excited to use it. Along the lines of bonding this has been a great purchase that continues to bring enjoyment.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: Glad I bought on sale, but still pricey for what it is
customer_reviews.text: I feel bad for anyone that paid $100 for this. While the plastic resin pieces are highly detailed, it is still just plastic. The playing board is like a standard board game, a folding fiber board covered in slick film. For what the set is, even $40 was more than I think it is worth. I guess that is the price of licensing though. The set is high quality for a board game. My son does love it though, being a Harry Potter and chess fan.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: "That's wizard's chess!"
customer_reviews.text: I can't afford the $400 set I really want from Noble Collection so this will do for now! One reviewer mentioned filling in the hallow base of each piece with something to make it heavier so that's what I'm going to do with polymer clay. Other than that, the set is very nice. One knight's horse has a gimpy leg so the piece sits crooked but I guess I can live with that.
customer_reviews.author: BethanyG

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: I was eexcited to get this only to be somewhat disappointed that it was plastic. I don't believe I saw that mentioned in the description.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Kimsey

customer_reviews.title: Hogwarts Fans will love it
customer_reviews.text: Bought and gave this to my 9 year old grandson who had discovered and loves any and all things Harry Potter. He plays it with his father and mother. Great big board and game pieces which makes it easy for his little hands , he is little for his age due to hormone issues, but that's besides the point, because the pieces are bigger than regular chess game pieces he is able to grab, pick up , and move the pieces easily .
customer_reviews.author: carla curtis

customer_reviews.title: Great HP fan gift. Hard to maneuver
customer_reviews.text: Pieces are plastic, but well constructed. The board feels like it will deteriorate sooner than expected, not impressed with the quality there. The pieces are beautiful BUT if you plan on actually playing with them, the space on the board seems a bit too small because the pieces are tall, so you end up knocking them out often (unintentionally). Also, it takes some time to get used to the difference between the queen and the bishop.
customer_reviews.author: MominGA

customer_reviews.title: Good size
customer_reviews.text: It's a little bit cheap. Plastic lightweight pieces and an average foldable board. Could really use some serious paint details. I will happily do thqt myself because I'm artsy and obsessed. Also adding small weights to the bases to add some heaviness. Favorite things are the designs of course. Classy and easy to recognize pieces. Ahh the memories of that first HP movie!
customer_reviews.author: Gerrit J Nieuwenhuis

customer_reviews.title: Magic Board
customer_reviews.text: I got this board as a present for my girlfriend The board is very nice and she said she “loved the pieces, they’re just like real Harry Potter”. The only problem I had with the board was that in the questions section it says the pieces do not move like in the movie. Well we were playing and at some point while I was about to take the queen I looked away and the board was flipped over on it’s own. Definetly seemed like they were inaccurate about the pieces moving on their own. So I’ll take a star off for that. Other wise great board game.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Well done and FUN!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 7 year old Grandson for Christmas. The pieces are wonderful. They are made of quality plastic, gray and black and perfectly replicate the pieces from the movie. He was so excited when he realized it was HP chess set. Not an expensive set, just beautifully made for it's price range and just plain fun. Would buy again if I need a HPFan gift for someone else, no matter their age.
customer_reviews.author: nan

customer_reviews.title: Not great quality
customer_reviews.text: The board itself isn’t great quality. The plastic covering around the cardboard had bubbles and were not cut straight etc. The pieces themselves had some paint rubbed off. I plan to fix it myself rather than return it because I really want a wizards chess set but it’s quite a Bit of money for this quality. I thought official Harry Potter product would be better quality.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Harrypotter chess set!! OMG!!
customer_reviews.text: This chess set is so cool, even though i don't play chess much i had to have this set! its absolutely amazing. They were plastic and my knight piece broke after a game but other than that its great, but who cares!! its harry potter chess set! I wish they came in marble, but then i would not be able to afford it probably :)
customer_reviews.author: Meena

customer_reviews.title: Bitter Disappointment
customer_reviews.text: For $40 and the Noble Collection name I figured that these would be some nicely detailed Chess Pieces. They are not. Hollow cheap plastic. I have a verry heavy Marble board I was planning on putting them on but they look and feel cheap. My star wars chess set was nicer than this and it cost half the price. I will keep looking.
customer_reviews.author: K. Davis

customer_reviews.title: Wife and I love HP, so.....
customer_reviews.text: My wife wanted to play chess and we are big fans of Harry Potter. This just made sense to get her for Xmas. It is a decent set for the cost and the pieces look just like the movie. Some pieces have smaller parts they are "holding". It is all molded but some of it is weak and looks like they could break off eventually. My wife and I do not care about this.
customer_reviews.author: reebohyeah

customer_reviews.title: If only they moved when we spoke, they'd be perfect! 😉
customer_reviews.text: My son said this was his favorite Christmas gift. Since they play wizard chess on Christmas in the books, of course we had to spend the afternoon playing. The pieces are sturdy with fairly good detail. They come with bags for each set of chessmen. Great addition to any Harry Potter fan collection, especially if they also like chess.
customer_reviews.author: rooksies5

customer_reviews.title: Exaggerated objects
customer_reviews.text: The chess pieces are made of plastic, which is easy to deform, because they are too light, and they often fall on the board. The board is also a piece of plastic, which is not too good in quality. The only selling point is the Theme of Harry Potter, which my daughter likes very much.I don't think I would recommend it to my friends.
customer_reviews.author: leon

customer_reviews.title: Nice set!
customer_reviews.text: Great set for a fan of both chess and the Potter series. The pieces are plastic which makes lightweight but the pieces are nice and sturdy. The pic is a white rook so you can see the sizing. The board is very nice also. My son loves it... we agree that it would make a nice gift.
customer_reviews.author: HollyA

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: The product looks very cheap. The figures are plastic and the chess board is the same as a game board. We bought it to display in our home since my family are avid chess players and Harry Potter fans. It was put up after a few games. The pieces are huge. Looks very cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Vasquez

customer_reviews.title: Good, but plastic is not 100% trimmed
customer_reviews.text: This was a great gift for my girlfriend who loves both chess and Harry Potter! She really enjoyed looking at every piece and we played it a couple times right after I gave it to her. The price was decent but some of the pieces had a bit too much extra plastic left over from the molds they were made in. I did adjust some pieces and gently sanded the edges after we played a few times. Overall it was worth it and she is very happy to have it.
customer_reviews.author: Breanna

customer_reviews.title: Great detail and size!
customer_reviews.text: Aside from being plastic, I love everything about this set... and even more important, my grandson is thrilled with it (his favorite birthday present out of quite a few). The detail is beautiful. The pieces are larger than in a typical chess set, and even though the board is folded cardboard, it is very nice looking and will last a long time with proper care.
customer_reviews.author: Bernadette Wulf

customer_reviews.title: 2 Queens no King in Black.
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited for this chess set as a Harry Potter fan and just excited to switch it up from regular pieces. I recieved two queens and no King on the black set. Had plans to play with friends so when it got here it was really annoying having to keep track which Queen was the "King". I'll probably have to go through the hassle of returning it and everything. SMH.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: They love it!
customer_reviews.text: This chess set really focussed the lads on chess. Nothing quite like "Wizard Chess" to inspire young, literate minds. The set is a little cheaply made, for the price, but you could glue your own weights to the bottom of the pieces to give them a more solid and balanced feel and, although I think it's a little cheaply made, it was a BIG HIT with two of my favourite Harry Potter fans.
customer_reviews.author: Winnie and Max

customer_reviews.title: Price?/Ok - quality?/NO
customer_reviews.text: The idea of getting the chess piece from Harry Potter sounded like it would be cool to have. I went with this one for the sale. So I would not have to drop 350+ on the set. When I unboxed the first and Second Red flags that hit me was that the pieces were in cheap bags and when I removed them I noticed that all the pieces were of low quality and that all the knight's maces and bishops staffs were bent at odd angles. I'm not happy with the set, but I now have a Harry Potter chess set
customer_reviews.author: Robert W. Osborne

customer_reviews.title: great gift for the young Hogwart's student
customer_reviews.text: Fun chess set and quality is about what you'd expect it's not an heirloom or anything of the sort. Got 4 stars b/c the squares on the board need to be slightly bigger and the knights are so off balance the tip over with a stiff breeze (just superglue a quarter into the base).
customer_reviews.author: JHB

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing cheapness but with alterations Fun for Potter fans.
customer_reviews.text: Like others have stated the board is quad-fold thin cardboard. But for Harry Potter fans the pieces are satisfying except for one problem--due to their weight they fall over a lot. Others have suggested drilling a hole in the bottom of each piece, filling them with BB shot and sealing shut. This is a timely action but it works if it is worth it to you.
customer_reviews.author: Mexican Fan

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for kids learning chess who love Harry Potter
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my son for his birthday since he is just learning to play chess, and loves Harry Potter. The black and white chess pieces come with their own bag for storage. The pieces are made of plastic. This is not a bad thing, as kids tend to drop and break glass or stone pieces. While plastic, hey are well designed, and heavier than you might think, so they are not cheaply made.
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: Worth it but not at full price!
customer_reviews.text: My son loves this set!! We got this at a deeply discounted price and I think it was worth the purchase at what I paid. I would have been very disappointed if I had paid full price for this set since the pieces are a plastic and the board folds. I do appreciate the organza bags to put the pieces in. The pieces are sturdy and weighted. The board was also sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey Cameron

customer_reviews.title: Missing piece
customer_reviews.text: We love this set, but it arrived missing a white piece.
customer_reviews.author: Amity

customer_reviews.title: Harry Potter Wizard Chess Is A Definite Hit
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Harry Potter Wizard Chess Game for my 12 year old grandson who loves it. The Chess pieces are like the ones on the movie's wizard chess game and are made of a sturdy plastic which should last. The pieces come in bags and the board and box are seemingly sturdy. I was very pleased with it and my grandson definitely was pleased with it for a Christmas gift.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Coster

customer_reviews.title: Great Harry Potter Wizard Chess set!
customer_reviews.text: I've been resistant to letting my husband teach me to play chess, so I got this for him so that he could teach me and I'd be more interested because of the Harry Potter aspect. The pieces are really detailed and the board is nice. The pieces are plastic (I don't know if it says that anywhere, I wasn't sure until we'd opened it up). I didn't win the one match we played, but I don't blame the game set.
customer_reviews.author: H. Carrion

customer_reviews.title: Great gift for chess & HP fans
customer_reviews.text: Gave this as a gift to my son for his 13th birthday since he loves chess and HP. He was thrilled and pulled everything out immediately to set up the board for us to play. The pieces are plastic, but they look just like the pieces from the movie.
customer_reviews.author: japlaza

customer_reviews.title: Great Set
customer_reviews.text: My grandson LOVES this set !!! And can now beat me at Chess !! Ha Ha !! It has really encouraged him to learn and understand chess and enjoy it !! And I get to spend time with my grandson !! A win win !!
customer_reviews.author: Bobbie S

customer_reviews.title: Fun set, but not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: A fun set, but the Board is cheap cardboard (think standard board game type) and the pieces are all plastic. You’re paying for the name stamped on it :( still, my diehard Potter fan loved it. Would not recommend or buy again for this price. I should have more carefully read the description.
customer_reviews.author: Pat Graham

customer_reviews.title: Looks great, but Knight Piece broke.
customer_reviews.text: My son loves Harry Potter, and this Chess set looks really nice, but way the horses / knights are made, they broke after one use. The horses feet are not placed in the base well enough. The other pieced seem to be fine. I'm returning the first set due to the knights breaking and will try one more. The manufacturer should redesign the knight.
customer_reviews.author: PETER

customer_reviews.title: Base of the figurines are hollow
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful plastic set. Only issue is that they are top heavy so the Knights, especially, continue to fall over and knock neighboring pieces over too as a result. If you take the time to fill the hollow bases in with something this will be a very enjoyable children's set.
customer_reviews.author: J. L. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Box torn up
customer_reviews.text: When the box arrived the shipping box was fine. Upon opening the box, the actual product box was destroyed. The overall product was good, and has decent quality. I can't use this as a display now. It looks like someone punched the box.
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money paid
customer_reviews.text: This set is cheaper than expected. The pieces are a cheap plastic and tend to fall over easily when playing. The playing board is just a folded piece of cardboard. Not worth the money. I bought this for my son's birthday, a big potter fan, he was very excited to get it, but let down at the quality. I would rather have a nice chess set instead of this one.
customer_reviews.author: perry

customer_reviews.title: Great quality for the price.
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing alternative to the higher quality version which last time I checked cost $400+. For 1/10th of the cost you get almost the same size pieces, pliable plastic rather than the harder material, and a board that looks pretty. No regrets at all on this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Magurtis

customer_reviews.title: Good starter set but material is cheap
customer_reviews.text: Great starter themed set for my Harry Potter loving 12 year old! The chess pieces are made of very cheap astkc so that is a HUGE downside for the price. Had they been glass or ceramic I would have paid more!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Ashlock

customer_reviews.title: Great collectible
customer_reviews.text: My wife is a huge potter head so I finally found a way to get her to play chess. The board is very plain but I love how the pieces look. My only gripe is that the pieces are made of plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Shen

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made and incorrectly weighted pieces
customer_reviews.text: These look and feel cheap. For most pieces the top is heavy and the base is hollow so they fall easily. Very disappointed but will keep the set because my son is an HP fan and enjoys playing chess.
customer_reviews.author: S

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This gift is AMAZING! I bought this for my nephew and check it by myself and kept it for me and bought something else for my nephew. I know that I am a bad person but it was SOOOOO GOOOD!
customer_reviews.author: batuhan

customer_reviews.title: Kids love it!
customer_reviews.text: My 14 year old son loves this set. We purchased it for a birthday gift and he was very happy. The detail on the pieces is very unique and sharp. It comes with the board and bags to hold the different pieces, which we appreciated so they don't get lost.
customer_reviews.author: Frozen North

customer_reviews.title: A little disappointed..
customer_reviews.text: So I bought this because I’ve always liked to play chess, and when I was younger I wanted the Harry Potter replica. Well now I have it, and I love it. But I am a little disappointed because I was hoping it was like glass or stone, they’re plastic, and I was expecting a glass or stone board as well and it’s like a cardboard. I will say I’m glad I got it on sale, and not for the normal $100, cause I’d definitely send it back.
customer_reviews.author: Kody Bland

customer_reviews.title: It's super cheap. Not worth more than $10
customer_reviews.text: This was such a disappointing order. It was a card board chess board and the pieces were plastic. It's made for small children.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fun, but made on the cheap
customer_reviews.text: The sculpts are really nice on these pieces, but they are very lightweight plastic, with a hollow base. This makes them very easy to topple over, or accidentally bump out of place.
customer_reviews.author: S. Rowley

customer_reviews.title: QUALITY CONTROL
customer_reviews.text: The chess peices are made of plastic, which is fine.. the board has ripples in it. The fact it came with a peice without a stand really ticks me off though, specially since this was a gift for a friend.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed quality
customer_reviews.text: My husband enjoys chess. I purchased this for his birthday to replaced a damaged chess set. I was disappointed with the quality of the pieces (plastic) with a hollow base and board (flimsy cardboard). Previous chess sets of similar value were painted and felt bottoms (weighted) and yes, some of those are plastic pieces as well.
customer_reviews.author: Taryn Gibbs

customer_reviews.title: Made of CHEAP PLASTIC
customer_reviews.text: EXTREMELY DISAPPOINTED: After paying about half a hundred dollars for this product I find the pieces were made out of a weaker plastic. One of my knights is lopsided, all four bishops have staffs that are crooked. A majority of the pieces are top heavy and fall over easily which can cause major problems in messing up the board. I am not happy with this chess set.
customer_reviews.author: Tamra

customer_reviews.title: Grandson loves it!
customer_reviews.text: My grandson was thrilled to get this. It seems well made and all the pieces were clearly recognizable. I did think it was too expensive but I know that is probably due to the "Harry Potter" brand name.
customer_reviews.author: LakewoodElf

customer_reviews.title: My son loves it
customer_reviews.text: The chess looks very nice at this price. My 12 year old son loves it and played many games with me after he received it. It will be perfect if the board can be a little bit bigger.
customer_reviews.author: Anne

customer_reviews.title: Plastic Pieces
customer_reviews.text: This is very detailed and looks great. However, the chess pieces are made of a light plastic and I was hoping for a more dense material or ever a harder plastic. The pieces are kind of flimsy. I purchased this on sale but the original price of $100 is over priced for the quality of the pieces. It's a great gift but if you want a collectors piece I'd look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Autumn

customer_reviews.title: Great and fun chess set
customer_reviews.text: Me and my son (10 years old) really enjoy the chess set. The pieces and board are very sturdy. The only negative is the pieces are a bit large so it can be difficult moving them around and not knocking over other pieces in accident. I’m satisfied with the purchase overall.
customer_reviews.author: Drew

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: This is such a neat chess set. The design of each piece is appealing. The board is ok, not great. It could be better quality and the squares on the board could be a bit larger, to help prevent the large game pieces from constantly getting knocked over. Otherwise, we’ve enjoyed playing with it today.
customer_reviews.author: JM7654321

customer_reviews.title: very realistic and looks great.
customer_reviews.text: I liked this chess set. It looks just like the movies and the pieces are decently detailed. I did not like that they did not have weights in the bottom of the pieces. To me it just seemed like they would knock over easily but they stayed upright just fine and work just as expected. I just prefer a little more weight behind my pieces so that if I move across the board and accidentally hit a piece it stays upright.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Nikolauzyk

customer_reviews.title: If you can accept the imperfections the chess set is acceptable.
customer_reviews.text: Gave as a gift. Bishop staffs look limp. Pieces look as if they are worn maybe so as to appear as if they were in battle. My son is willing to accept the imperfections and says the chess set seems to be durable.
customer_reviews.author: envy04

customer_reviews.title: Great replica of in-movie chess set!
customer_reviews.text: My 8 year old son got this for a gift and he absolutely loves it! He had never played before but instantly was interested and now plays regularly with kids and adults
customer_reviews.author: bchcrzzr

customer_reviews.title: Better than Ok but not Great
customer_reviews.text: Vendor was fine, got it on time. Item is cool, I wish them made a more deluxe version of this. The pieces are made of a sturdy plastic so they don’t feel too cheap or flimsy. The board is just foldable cardboard like many other chess boards. Overall we like it.
customer_reviews.author: Person

customer_reviews.title: solid chess set
customer_reviews.text: Pieces are well modeled and sturdy, bags for the pieces are nice looking too. the board is a standard foldout, nothing special but its fine. Great Christmas gift to the family, we've been playing nonstop.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Brewer

customer_reviews.title: Great chess set
customer_reviews.text: Nice weight to the pieces. All was in the box, nothing missing. We've enjoyed playing this Harry Potter chess set. Was surprised the chess pieces decided to not move on their own. We need to earn the trust of the pieces. Until they trust us, we will have to move them ourselves.
customer_reviews.author: Mystic Falls

customer_reviews.title: Save your money.
customer_reviews.text: Looks like the pieces came off a cheap 3D printer. They definitely did a good job at staging the set because it’s much cheaper than it appears on the photos. I guess you’re paying for the official Harry Potter license because the set isn’t worth the resin and cardboard it’s made of.
customer_reviews.author: Michael D. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Fun chess set for kids!
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my daughter's birthday, she turned 11 and absolutely loved it! The only issue with ours is that it came with one of the Queen's heads detached. Everytime my daughter plays she just puts the head back in place. So it still works and fits her needs. This chess set has been a great addition to our family game collection. I have appreciated that the pieces are heavy duty plastic, so they hold up to the kids playing with them.
customer_reviews.author: Brookelynn Martin

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful set
customer_reviews.text: My husband and 10 yr. old grandson play chess weekly on FaceTime. We had rhis set sent to him for Christmas this year. When he opened it (FaceTime) he totally flipped. He showed us each piece. The board is beautiful. This Sunday will be the first match using it. Can't wait!
customer_reviews.author: sower

customer_reviews.title: Great birthday gift
customer_reviews.text: In my estimation the pieces are very attractive and sturdy enough for my grandkids--ages 9 and 5. The older one and her grandfather enjoy playing chess with this set.
customer_reviews.author: Caren

customer_reviews.title: Magical and Beautiful...
customer_reviews.text: This set is really nice looking. The board is nice and well made for a cardboard board and it is a great size. The pieces are very beautiful but a little awkward. They are a little top heavy and the bags they come in are a little fragile. The box it comes in is really nice and sturdy. Overall a great set for someone who collects Harry Potter or Chess memorabilia. Not made for a camping trip or anything more than nice table top play and display.
customer_reviews.author: Jester

customer_reviews.title: Good gift!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my boyfriend and he adores it. It’s good quality for the price and a great price. I would recommend this to anyone I know.
customer_reviews.author: Bethany

customer_reviews.title: Got my kids excited to play chess so I am very happy with the purchase
customer_reviews.text: My kids are playing chess and loving it so it was worth every penny to me. But they are not as high quality as you might expect for what I paid but I guess you are just paying for the Harry Potter brand
customer_reviews.author: 4051kris

customer_reviews.title: SO much nostalgia
customer_reviews.text: The figures are so so cute! I knew that they weren't metal when I bought them, but part of me feels a little jipped that they are just plastic, but they are molded well and cute. I also wish the board was a bit better quality, but it gets the job done. I bought this as a present for my friends birthday and she LOVES it.
customer_reviews.author: Jonni Machado

customer_reviews.title: Great set
customer_reviews.text: For a potter head this is an outstanding gift! It’s a bit more underwhelming of quality then I anticipated but that’s ok. Over I would definitely buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Desiree Stringer

customer_reviews.title: Meh.. leaves something to be desired
customer_reviews.text: Honestly would have expected these to be cast metal figures at this price point or even glass but sadly they are plastic..
customer_reviews.author: Andrew DeCree

customer_reviews.title: Nice set.
customer_reviews.text: Nice set and my grandson was really excited by it. The cardboard playing board is going to get tossed as it won't hold up but I can get him a nicer one. The characters were nicely done but I thought they were going to be stiff plastic. Some of the characters have some flexible smaller parts that are less than sturdy looking.
customer_reviews.author: J. Kennedy

customer_reviews.title: Not very solid for the price....
customer_reviews.text: It looks nice, but the pieces are very cheaply made. I assumed for the high price they would be more solid or heavier, but honestly, the monopoly player pieces are more dense.
customer_reviews.author: A. N.

customer_reviews.title: Missing piece (extra King instead of Bishop) and cheap plastic parts
customer_reviews.text: The marketing image makes the pieces to appear metal when they are really cheap plastic. The chess set was missing a bishop. Instead, there were two kings with one of the king's staff bent as shown in the picture. The chessboard is foldable cheap cardboard. I would expect the quality for a $20 board, but not for $45-$50 board.
customer_reviews.author: HH

customer_reviews.title: A must have for any Harry Potter fan who plays chess!!
customer_reviews.text: My 8yr old kid is a die hard Harry Potter fan and is also into chess. Got this as a surprise gift for him and he’s thrilled to have two of his interests in one. The Chess Set looks cool and the pieces are designed exactly the same way they appear in the movies. They are plastic but not very cheap. The chess board looks good too. It’s a very cool chess set to have. It’s definitely a head turner!!
customer_reviews.author: T P

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: This is a Christmas present for my son that collects chessboards, I was really excited when I saw the pieces it’s pretty cool
customer_reviews.author: Ronda Middleton

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price, looks really good, and don't misinterpret the quality!!!
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this was an excellent gift. The pieces are very cool looking and made of a hard rubber/plastic mixture. Best thing about that is the small parts of the pieces are flexible so if dropped they don't break right off. With that in mind, if given to a younger person, they may break them off, but that isn't the fault of the maker of this set in my opinion. Overall, very pleased with it compared to the $80+ Harry Potter sets.
customer_reviews.author: Rob W.

customer_reviews.title: Not what it claims
customer_reviews.text: Ok so yes it does say “Harry Potter” all over but it’s just the printed materials. The pieces are just general “wizard” type characters, NOT Harry Potter related at all. I sent it back.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Robinson

customer_reviews.title: High quality and looks.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality, the pieces details are amazing. It's the best option for a gift or for collectors
customer_reviews.author: Oscar L Rueda

customer_reviews.title: I love it
customer_reviews.text: My girlfriend decided to get me this as a gift because she knew I love Harry Potter. For a true fan... This is the ultimate gift!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kamaal Greene

customer_reviews.title: Love it but needs improvement
customer_reviews.text: My son loves it of course, but the pieces are light weight plastic and knock over easily when making a move. It would be nice it the pieces had a little more weight to them.
customer_reviews.author: atx mom

customer_reviews.title: He loves the board and the pieces since they are just like the movie
customer_reviews.text: My son adores this Chess set. We bought it for him for Christmas since he is a huge Harry Potter fan and just recently joined the chess club at school. He loves the board and the pieces since they are just like the movie. It has really encouraged him to keep playing chess and to strive to get better and better.
customer_reviews.author: Mo2K

customer_reviews.title: Nice set for children.
customer_reviews.text: Great Harry Potter set but the pieces do not fit well on the board when placed. Some pieces have to be facing opposite ways or they fall over. Cheeper plastic than expecting
customer_reviews.author: Taylor Frank

product_meta.title: Harry Potter Wizard Chess Set
feature_bullets: Set includes chess pieces and playing board. Chess pieces measure 2 to 4 inches. Playing board is 18.5 x 18.5 inches.
